Hoover Institution Archives

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Memoirs, other writings, correspondence, genealogical charts, legal and financial papers, printed matter, and photographs, relating to the royal family of Romania, the history of the House of Hohenzollern, and Romanian émigré affairs
did.langmaterial: Romanian, French, German, English and Spanish.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Nicolas, Prince of Romania Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Prince Nicolas was the second son of King Ferdinand and of Queen Maria of Romania, brother of Marie, queen of Yugoslavia, and of Elizabeth, queen of Greece.

He was born on August 18, 1903 and studied in the English Navy School of Malta. After 1927, during the minority of his nephew, the future King Michael I, he served as Romanian Regent (together with the Patriarch Miron Cristea and the president of the Court of Cassation, Gh. Buzdugan).

In 1930 he was instrumental in bringing back his elder brother Carol, who had gone into voluntary exile in 1925, and helped to proclaim him king. However, he was exiled in 1937 for political opposition to the dictatorship of the new monarch. Except for his mother's funeral in 1938, he never went back to Romania.

During his exile, in Italy, Switzerland, and Spain, Prince Nicolas was politically active. He founded the Romanian Center for Research (Centre Roumain de Recherches) in France, patronized by the French Academy, as well as the Romanian Cultural Foundation: Princess Ioana (Fundatia Culturala Romana: Printesa Ioana) in Germany. He participated in numerous meetings of Romanian émigrés from all over Europe, gave speeches at Romanian cultural events, and addressed radio broadcasts to Romanians from Romania and abroad. He also started two Romanian publications in Madrid.
He married Joana Doletti in 1963 and, following her death, Thereza Figueira de Mello. Prince Nicolas died in 1978.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists mainly of Prince Nicolas's memoirs and his writings on political, social, religious, educational, and economic conditions in Romania. Also of special interest are the materials related to the Romanian émigré associations and to the Hohenzollern dynasty, found in the subject file.

Includes biographical notes, inventories of personal objects, and miscellaneous papers related to Prince Nicolas's citizenship, marriages, succession, and death, arranged alphabetically by physical form
Correspondence arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent
Includes Prince Nicolas's memoirs, speeches, interviews, and miscellaneous writings arranged chronologically by title
Includes miscellaneous material arranged alphabetically by subject, and related mainly to Romanian émigré associations, to conditions in Romania, and to Romanians politics
319 prints depicting mainly Prince Nicolas and members of the Hohenzollern dynasty

Genealogical charts, maps, printed matter relating to Romania and the Hohenzollern dynasty, and reproductions of pencil drawings depicting Prince Nicolas and Princess Ioana of Hohenzollern, arranged alphabetically by physical form

did.unittitle: Biographical notes, portraits, etc. on Prince Nicolas, by others, 1949-1979
Clippings relating to Prince Nicolas's various activities, 1950-1971
Inventories of personal objects, 1963-1973. Includes letters and telegrams related to their acquisition, value, and sale
Death. Includes notes relating to his death, memorial service, obituaries, 1978

Marriage, 1967-1975. Documents relating to Prince Nicolas's marriage to Thereza Figueira de Mello. Includes mariage certificate and statement relating to the Prince's renunciation of the Orthodox faith and adoption of the catholic one
Reception given by Prince Nicolas in honor of the Romanian colony in Spain, 1953 December 19. Letters and telegrams
Succession, 1969-1979. Includes Prince Nicolas's concession of Spanish passport, and his will

George VI, King of Great Britain, 1945
Mary, Consort of George V, King of Great Britain, 1945

"Aide-memoire asupra situatiei si stadiului diferitelor chestiuni, asa dupa cum au evoluat in ultimul timp si in special in ultimele 10 zile, si in masura in care se pot descrie," 1949. Typescript
"Con el Principe Prince Nicolas de Romania," interview, Madrid, Madrid, 1950. Printed copy
"Madrid es una ciudad encantadora," interview, Arriba, 1950. Printed copy
"Radiobotschaft von Seiner Koeniglichen Hoheit, Prinz Nikolaus von Rumanien," Madrid, 1950. Typescript
"Sistematica destruccion de Romania bajo el dominio ruso," interview, A.B.C., Madrid, 1950. Printed copy
"Soy un soldado de primera linea," interview, YA, Madrid, 1950. Printed copy
"Message de S.A.R. le Prince Nicolas de Roumanie transmis par radio le 25 decembre 1950," Madrid, 1950 December 25. Typescript. Includes Romanian and German versions
"Aide-memoire" (on the occasion of Prince Nicolas's first visit to Franco, in 1950), 1951. Typescript
Speech, dinner given in Prince Nicolas's honor by the Anglo-American Association of Paris, Paris, 1952. Typescript
"Romania 1952: Situatie, istorie, rost, structura si problema," Paris, 1952. Typescript. Includes French version
Speech given on the occasion of the 10th of May, Madrid, 1952. Typescript
Radio broadcast transcript given at Easter, Madrid, 1953. Typescript
"De vorba cu A.S. Regala principele Nicolae al Romaniei," Madrid, 1954. Typescript
"Mesaj al Principelui Nicolae catre lumea libera," Madrid, 1954. Typescript
A.C.A.R.D.A. (Cultural Association of the Romanians from the UK), 1964-1978. Clippings, letters, memoranda, magazines, biographical notes on Ion Ratiu, miscellaneous materials
Association Cultural Romana en Espana, 1957. Note on the 80th celebration of Romanian independence
Association des Chevaliers Italiens de l'Ordre Souverain Militaire de Malte," 1924. Statute. Includes Italian version

General. Note concerning some Romanian cultural materials from the Swiss Legation in Madrid, n.d.
Drama. Includes a play by I. L. Caragiale, entitled "Fatalidad"
History-1914-1944. Includes writings of D. Damaceanu, G. Gafencu, Petrin(?), A. Simion
Romanian Legionaire Movement, 1968. Newsletter issue (Tara si exilul)
Romanians in foreign countries, 1971-1977. Notes, clippings, letters, and memoranda

132 prints depicting Prince Nicolas and others, including Princess Ioana of Hohenzollern; Princess Thereza of Hohenzollern; Elizabeth, Consort of George II, King of Greece; Ferdinand, King of Romania; Marie, Consort of Ferdinand, King of Romania; Victoria-Eugenia, Consort of Alfonso XIII, King of Spain; Simeon II, King of Bulgaria; Leonida Georgievna, Grand Duchess of Russia; and Vladimir Kirillovich, Grand Duke of Russia, 1930-1970
1 print depicting Elizabeth, Consort of George II, King of Greece, n.d.
6 prints depicting aspects of Romanian civilization, 1930-1958
3 prints depicting members of the House of Hohenzollern, 1922-1934
2 albums containing 114 prints depicting art objects, n.d.
10 prints depicting Prince Nicolas; Princess Ioana of Hohenzollern; Elizabeth, Consort of George II, King of Greece, and others, n.d.
Genealogical charts related to the House of Hohenzollern, n.d.
Issues of L'Illustration, 1926-1929, and La Ilustracion, 1912. Includes articles on Romania
Maps of the Brosteni domain, n.d.
Reproductions of pencil drawings depicting Prince Nicolas and Princess Ioana of Hohenzollern, n.d.
